net.avensome.dev.gnupolpot.api

Class Tool

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.avensome.dev.gnupolpot.api.Tool

  • public abstract class Tool
extends java.lang.Object
    A tool is a piece of app's functionality. Tools change behavior of the plot when user is interacting with it.

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Tool()

        public Tool()

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public abstract java.lang.String getName()
        Returns:
        Tool's name. Available in the Plugin info window and tooltips.

      • getButtonImage

        public javafx.scene.image.Image getButtonImage()
        Returns:
        An object representing image that will be painted on tool's button in the sidebar.

      • activated

        public void activated(Api api)
        Called when tool is activated. Don't call this manually unless you know what you're doing. Most of the time you probably rather want to use Api.selectTool(Tool).
        Parameters:
        api - API interface

      • deactivated

        public void deactivated(Api api)
        Called when tool is deactivated. Don't call this manually unless you know what you're doing. Most of the time you probably rather want to use Api.selectTool(Tool).
        Parameters:
        api - API interface

      • receiveMouseEvent

        public abstract void receiveMouseEvent(Api api,
                                       MouseEventType eventType,
                                       javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event,
                                       boolean focusedPointChanged)
        Called when user interacts with the plot using a mouse pointer.
        Parameters:
        api - API interface
        eventType - type of mouse event that triggered this method
        event - JavaFX mouse pointer event from plot's perspective
        focusedPointChanged - whether this event changed the focused point (de-focusing all points is a change too)

      • receiveScrollEvent

        public void receiveScrollEvent(Api api,
                               javafx.scene.input.ScrollEvent event)
        Called when user interacts with the plot using a mouse wheel.
        Parameters:
        api - API interface
        event - JavaFX mouse wheel event
